Title: Vision disorders and visual impairment
Source: The Curated Reference Collection in Neuroscience and Biobehavioral Psychology
Abstract: © 2017 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.Visual development is an interactive process between the eye and brain, with rapid functional development of the visual cortex in the first year of life. Disorders can originate at each level in the eye-brain system and interact with development at the others. This chapter outlines the problems and relations of retinal dystrophies, visual deprivation, strabismus, amblyopia, refractive errors, cerebral visual impairment, and specific neurodevelopmental disorders including Williams Syndrome and Autistic Spectrum Disorder, and the hypothesis of ‘dorsal stream vulnerability’ which links a number of these disorders.
